Message.Title: Yahoo says obama to push economic vision
Message.Msg: What a joke! We are giving up our dividend to pay for the liberals on the Yahoo "news" staff. We have been asking Obama for his economic plan since 2008 before even being elected and he won't tell us. He has put us to $16 trillion in debt and hasn't once demanded that Senate pass a budget. Obama's wild spending has brought us over the fiscal cliff and devaluing our currency and savings. Because of this people are investing overseas not in the USA. The country's credit rating was downgraded for the first time in history under this president. There is a record number of people on food stamps. His labor department's response to unemployment is to falsely report that people are not participants in the job market so they can make the unemployment rates look lower. And Yahoo is eagerly awaiting Obama's economic push? Yahoo is giving us a bunch of spin to try prop up this complete failure in the White House
I see $21 + today, then we get news. After that, who knows!

Message.Title: Yahoo actual P/E is 18 instead of 6.35
Message.Msg: EPS excluding Alibaba sale is $1.17 instead of $3.28. So the actual P/E is 18 instead of 6.35 Last year, Yahoo spent 2.2 billions to buyback 12600M shares, but it only reduced the total outstanding shares from 1.18B to 1.17B due to too tons of options issued to management and employees. So 50% of the cash from selling half of the Alibaba shares was spent on buyback already but it did not reduce the outstanding shares at all. Now Yahoo has decided to stop buyback since it needs to spend a lot of more money on trying to turnaround. It's not working anyway. Yahoo revenue will be flat this year but the profit is very likely to drop siginificatally due to MSFT search deal and trunaround spending.

Topic.Title: Louder Whispers of Apple coming in for $35 buyout of Yahoo.

Message.Msg: Synergy? Do you even understand the concept? AAPL makes and sells top quality computers, cell phones, etc. and lots of music on itunes. It has first rate customer service and a fine management. Yahoo makes ...nothing...and sells ... advertising to people who think that those attracted to Yahoo by its free content will buy from them. It has minimum customer service and clearly a mediocre management many of whom would have to be replaced. Would the Yahoo "eyeballs" buy AAPL products? Those who want them already do. Will the AAPL product owners take advantage of Yahoo's free content and buy from the advertisers. They already can. So please tell me where is the synergy? Another garbage post.

Topic.Title: aapl, msft, goog, amzn, samsung and more all needs to place a bid for Yahoo

Message.Msg: Yeah... I am shocked to see how clueless all these big companies are and not trying harder to court Yahoo. Yahoo's Asian assets can easily buys any take over in $35 per share range given a couple years. Yahoo core basically is giving away for free at $35 per share. Yet, the core business packed so much value for the companies listed in my topic line. I think it is a matter of time that Yahoo will get bid up. I guess all these companies are playing chicken. Apple has the most fire power to take over Yahoo and I also think if Apple is serious about Apple TV, it got to take over Yahoo so it has a foot into Samsung's operation .... however, Samsung may want Yahoo since Yahoo has so much asset in Asian already and Yahoo TV will be in Samsung TV. The biggest looser will be microsoft ... still trying to figure out why they paid close to 10 billion for Skype. Couldn't they buy Yahoo and then build something Google phone has done? won't that give MSFT an instant global user base? Instead, Skype competes with many many different platforms. Not sure if MSFT can win a bidding war against AAPL and Samsung.

Topic.Title: talking ones book

Message.Msg: HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA you can't be serious? I've presented ways for Yahoo to make tons of money over the years, IMO wise acquisitions(Netflix when it was in the $40's before it shot to $300 and LinkedIn, a year or two ago when it was around $80 and has doubled), a REALISTIC buyout valuation of no more than $27.91 and that is saying AG is worth TRIPLE what it is. I correctly predicted earnings to a T and $1.5B buyback. Frankly, I've given more information than the rest of this board put together. I actually know where Yahoo Investors is located unlike those that "talk their book" as you would say. Funny thing is this is only my 3rd post today and 4th since Friday yet am on the minds of everyone apparently. I'm up for healthy discourse BUT what is the point as the same dumb people believe the same dumb buyout rumors(Apple, Samsung, FB, Myspace, MSFT, etc.) and never learn a single thing? Take for example Coldone and Bravo, they used to make so many posts that Yahoo would have to remove not thousands but TENS of thousands off their total and STILL say the same s*** as they did 5yrs ago, neither is any closer to breaking even either. Both need the upper $20's($28+ and a shade under $27, respectively, Bravo needs to make for the massive loss in 09' when he sold 3,000 shares at a $10 loss) Now if you ARE right that makes people upset too SO strictly entertainment as you can't win. Anything other than entertainment would be dangerous to your portfolio!
